summary: Build an interactive, beautiful Valentine-style webpage similar to the referenced example, with customization (names, photos, personal details) and an Islamic love letter component.
architectural_notes: Consider basic i18n support for the love letter section (at minimum: Bahasa Indonesia option for templates/default text).
known_issues: Prior build attempt failed with an AI processing error; user requested to try again.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine-style experience similar in spirit to the reference site, with an interactive flow (intro -> reveal -> letter -> gallery) and smooth transitions between sections.

Add a customization form that lets the user set sender name, recipient name, and additional personal details (at minimum: short title/headline and a few optional fields like date/place/short note), and instantly preview the changes on the page.
Support adding photos to the page via file upload (multiple images). Display them in an interactive gallery (e.g., carousel or masonry grid with lightbox).
Add an “Islamic love letter” section that provides (a) a selectable template library and (b) a fully editable custom letter area, with respectful language and styling.

Implement shareable personalization via URL query parameters for at least sender and recipient names (e.g., from/to). On page load, parse these parameters and prefill the customization state accordingly.
Apply a coherent, beautiful visual theme (no blue/purple default palette) with romantic + subtle Islamic geometric accents, consistent typography, spacing, and component styling across all sections.
Add lightweight delightful interactions: animated text reveal for the letter, gentle floating decorative elements, and micro-interactions on buttons/inputs; include an option to reduce motion.
Add generated static decorative assets (pattern background + frame/ornament elements) to the frontend and use them in the theme as non-intrusive visuals.

Translate the Islamic love letter template library into Bahasa Indonesia by updating `frontend/src/content/islamicLetterTemplates.ts` so that each template’s `title` and `content` are written in natural, respectful Indonesian while preserving Islamic references (e.g., Bismillah, Quran verse citations, and hadith references).

Update the Letter section defaults and placeholders to Bahasa Indonesia in `frontend/src/components/valentine/LetterSection.tsx`, including the fallback `displayFrom` value, the fallback `finalLetterText`, the textarea placeholder, and the sign-off line shown above the sender name, so that the letter experience is consistently Indonesian even before a template is selected.
